case_title: (M/S.) SRI VENKATA SATANARAYANA RICE MILL CONTRACTORS, CO. vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, ANDHRA PRADESH-II
case_number: Civil Appeal Nos. 5623-24 of 1983 with C.A. Nos. 5625, 5626 to 5637 and 5637-A of 1983
judges: B. N. Kirpal, J. S. Verma
appellant: (M/S.) SRI VENKATA SATANARAYANA RICE MILL CONTRACTORS, CO.
respondent: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, ANDHRA PRADESH-II

key_issues.issue: Whether contributions to the Andhra Pradesh Welfare Fund were allowable as business expenditure under Section 37(1) of the Income-tax Act, 1961.
Whether such contributions were opposed to public policy.

facts.payment_details: Contribution of Rs. 9,164/- to Andhra Pradesh Welfare Fund
facts.permit_condition: Export permits required payment to the welfare fund.

tribunal_decision.finding: Contributions were allowable under Section 37(1) as they were motivated by commercial considerations.
tribunal_decision.public_policy: Contributions were not opposed to public policy.

high_court_decision.finding: Contributions were compulsory but opposed to public policy.

supreme_court_decision.finding: Contributions were not illegal or opposed to public policy.
supreme_court_decision.principle_applied: Payments made for commercial expediency and business benefit are allowable under Section 37(1).
precedents_cited: Atherton v. British Insulated & Helsby Cables Ltd. (1926)
CIT v. Chandulal Keshavlal and Co. (1960)

final_ruling.deduction_allowed: Contributions to welfare fund allowable under Section 37(1).
